definitions.definition: To begin to understand; to realize.
definitions.example: He didn't have to explain; I caught on right away.

definitions.definition: To become popular; to become commonplace; to become the standard.
definitions.example: At first, many people didn't like that kind of music, but after a while it caught on.

definitions.definition: (of food) To become stuck to the cooking vessel; to brown or burn slightly.

antonyms: go the way of the dinosaurs
